related.description: Dan Miller had 19 points and Jordan Cornette had 13 rebounds and a school-record 11 blocked shots as Notre Dame set a school record with 19 blocked shots in a 76-48 victory over Belmont on Sunday in the first round of the Guardians Classic.
related.linkText: Irish swat away Belmont in Guardians Classic opener
related.title: Cornette leads Notre Dame's block party
related.headline: Cornette leads Notre Dame's block party

article.headline: Korver paces Creighton; Notre Dame rolls
article.linkText: Creighton, Irish cruise into Guardians Classic semis
article.story:
OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Kyle Korver scored 20 points as Creighton
beat Furman 82-57 Monday to win the Omaha half of the Guardians
Classic.

	 

Meanwhile, Notre Dame clobbered Indiana Purdue 89-45 Monday night in the tournament's other bracket. The Irish had already punched their ticket to the semifinals. Matt Carroll led Notre Dame with 26 points and Danny Miller added 17 points and 11 boards. 


  Korver was 5-for-9 on 3-pointers against Furman, following a
6-for-6 performance on Sunday.


	   Brody Deren finished with 16 points for Creighton and Larry
House added 10.

	   Creighton was 8-for-19 on 3-pointers Monday and made 23-of-44
3-point shot attempts in the tournament's two first games.

	   Karim Souchu led Furman with 22 points, while Guilherme Da Luz
scored 13 for the Paladins.

	   Both Creighton and Furman, by winning games in Sunday's opening
round of the Guardians Classic, earned a spot in the tournament's
championship round. The semifinals begin next Monday in Kansas
City, Mo.

	   The Bluejays and the Paladins will join Notre Dame and
Indiana-Purdue-Indianapolis, the two teams that won first-round
games Sunday at Notre Dame in South Bend, Ind.

	   Creighton scored 23 points off Furman's 19 first-half turnovers.
Furman committed 26 turnovers in the game.

	   Korver scored seven of his 11 first-half points as the Bluejays
opened the game with a 19-5 run.

	   Creighton later used an 11-3 surge to take a 38-24 lead into the
break.

	   Korver's back-to-back 3-pointers five minutes into the second
half sparked Creighton on a 14-0 run. By the time the spurt was
over, the Bluejays had control of the game and a 59-31 lead with 12
minutes remaining.
